verses.text: The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

similars.text: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.
Wherefore, let him do as the Spirit of the living God commandeth him, whether upon the land or upon the waters, as it remaineth with me to do hereafter.
He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
Nevertheless, all flesh is in mine hand, and he that is faithful among you shall not perish by the waters.
For I, the Lord, will cause them to bring forth as a very fruitful tree which is planted in a goodly land, by a pure stream, that yieldeth much precious fruit.
Nevertheless, unto whom is given power to command the waters, unto him it is given by the Spirit to know all his ways;
And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.

Therefore, O my son, whosoever will come may come and partake of the waters of life freely; and whosoever will not come the same is not compelled to come; but in the last day it shall be restored unto him according to his deeds.
And it shall be said in days to come that none is able to go up to the land of Zion upon the waters, but he that is upright in heart.
And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

verses.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the Lord pondereth the hearts.

similars.text: For I, the Lord, will judge all men according to their works, according to the desire of their hearts.
Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, so let him give; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.
He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
For every man shall bear his own burden.
Not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;
Behold, these things are in his own hands, let him do according to wisdom.

And now, behold, my beloved brethren, I suppose that ye ponder somewhat in your hearts concerning that which ye should do after ye have entered in by the way. But, behold, why do ye ponder these things in your hearts?
But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.
But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.
Behold, my soul delighteth in the things of the Lord; and my heart pondereth continually upon the things which I have seen and heard.

verses.text: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.

similars.text: For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:

O my son, I desire that ye should deny the justice of God no more. Do not endeavor to excuse yourself in the least point because of your sins, by denying the justice of God; but do you let the justice of God, and his mercy, and his long-suffering have full sway in your heart; and let it bring you down to the dust in humility.
Now it is better that a man should be judged of God than of man, for the judgments of God are always just, but the judgments of man are not always just.
Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.
I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.

And it is requisite with the justice of God that men should be judged according to their works; and if their works were good in this life, and the desires of their hearts were good, that they should also, at the last day, be restored unto that which is good.
Behold what the scripture says--man shall not smite, neither shall he judge; for judgment is mine, saith the Lord, and vengeance is mine also, and I will repay.

For it is expedient that there should be a great and last sacrifice; yea, not a sacrifice of man, neither of beast, neither of any manner of fowl; for it shall not be a human sacrifice; but it must be an infinite and eternal sacrifice.

Therefore God gave unto them commandments, after having made known unto them the plan of redemption, that they should not do evil, the penalty thereof being a second death, which was an everlasting death as to things pertaining unto righteousness; for on such the plan of redemption could have no power, for the works of justice could not be destroyed, according to the supreme goodness of God.

verses.text: An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.

similars.text: Behold, my soul abhorreth sin, and my heart delighteth in righteousness; and I will praise the holy name of my God.

O the wise, and the learned, and the rich, that are puffed up in the pride of their hearts, and all those who preach false doctrines, and all those who commit whoredoms, and pervert the right way of the Lord, wo, wo, wo be unto them, saith the Lord God Almighty, for they shall be thrust down to hell!
Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.
This was the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
Behold, my heart cries: Wo unto this people. Come out in judgment, O God, and hide their sins, and wickedness, and abominations from before thy face!
Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

But, notwithstanding the greatness of the task, I must do according to the strict commands of God, and tell you concerning your wickedness and abominations, in the presence of the pure in heart, and the broken heart, and under the glance of the piercing eye of the Almighty God.

The earth hath travailed and brought forth her strength;And truth is established in her bowels;And the heavens have smiled upon her;And she is clothed with the glory of her God;For he stands in the midst of his people.

And the hand of providence hath smiled upon you most pleasingly, that you have obtained many riches; and because some of you have obtained more abundantly than that of your brethren ye are lifted up in the pride of your hearts, and wear stiff necks and high heads because of the costliness of your apparel, and persecute your brethren because ye suppose that ye are better than they.
Be not ashamed, neither confounded; but be admonished in all your high-mindedness and pride, for it bringeth a snare upon your souls.

verses.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.

similars.text: Who being past feeling have given themselves over unto lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.
And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

For there are many yet on the earth among all sects, parties, and denominations, who are blinded by the subtle craftiness of men, whereby they lie in wait to deceive, and who are only kept from the truth because they know not where to find it--
Wo unto the wise in their own eyes and prudent in their own sight!
Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

O how foolish, and how vain, and how evil, and devilish, and how quick to do iniquity, and how slow to do good, are the children of men; yea, how quick to hearken unto the words of the evil one, and to set their hearts upon the vain things of the world!
And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

verses.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.

similars.text: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.

And when these things have passed away a speedy destruction cometh unto my people; for, notwithstanding the pains of my soul, I have seen it; wherefore, I know that it shall come to pass; and they sell themselves for naught; for, for the reward of their pride and their foolishness they shall reap destruction; for because they yield unto the devil and choose works of darkness rather than light, therefore they must go down to hell.
Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope;
So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

But behold, an awful death cometh upon the wicked; for they die as to things pertaining to things of righteousness; for they are unclean, and no unclean thing can inherit the kingdom of God; but they are cast out, and consigned to partake of the fruits of their labors or their works, which have been evil; and they drink the dregs of a bitter cup.
Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
Behold, I say unto you, there were jarrings, and contentions, and envyings, and strifes, and lustful and covetous desires among them; therefore by these things they polluted their inheritances.
Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected the same in hope,

verses.text: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.

similars.text: And seeing the people in a state of such awful wickedness, and those Gadianton robbers filling the judgment-seats--having usurped the power and authority of the land; laying aside the commandments of God, and not in the least aright before him; doing no justice unto the children of men;
But them that are without God judgeth. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.
For if they do reject these things the hour of their judgment is nigh, and their house shall be left unto them desolate.
Behold will they not testify that ye are murderers, yea, and also that ye are guilty of all manner of wickedness?
And thus he has laid a cunning plan, thinking to destroy the work of God; but I will require this at their hands, and it shall turn to their shame and condemnation in the day of judgment.
But, behold, the judgments of God will overtake the wicked; and it is by the wicked that the wicked are punished; for it is the wicked that stir up the hearts of the children of men unto bloodshed.
And if it so be that they will not believe these things, then shall the greater things be withheld from them, unto their condemnation.
But those who harden their hearts in unbelief, and reject it, it shall turn to their own condemnation--
Wo unto the wicked, for they shall perish; for the reward of their hands shall be upon them!

But behold, ye have rejected the truth, and rebelled against your holy God; and even at this time, instead of laying up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where nothing doth corrupt, and where nothing can come which is unclean, ye are heaping up for yourselves wrath against the day of judgment.

verses.text: The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.

similars.text: Great is his wisdom, marvelous are his ways, and the extent of his doings none can find out.
For there is a time appointed for every man, according as his works shall be.
A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.
But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.
Now of this thing ye must judge. Behold, I say unto you, that it is on the one hand even as it is on the other; and it shall be unto every man according to his work.
There are many things contained therein that are not true, which are interpolations by the hands of men.
Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

Behold, great and marvelous are the works of the Lord. How unsearchable are the depths of the mysteries of him; and it is impossible that man should find out all his ways. And no man knoweth of his ways save it be revealed unto him; wherefore, brethren, despise not the revelations of God.

verses.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

similars.text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
Let him who is on the housetop flee, and not return to take anything out of his house;
For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.
Their basket shall not be full, their houses and their barns shall perish, and they themselves shall be despised by those that flattered them.

Yea, except ye repent, your women shall have great cause to mourn in the day that they shall give suck; for ye shall attempt to flee and there shall be no place for refuge; yea, and wo unto them which are with child, for they shall be heavy and cannot flee; therefore, they shall be trodden down and shall be left to perish.
For this ordinance belongeth to my house, and cannot be acceptable to me, only in the days of your poverty, wherein ye are not able to build a house unto me.
And a man's foes shall be they of his own household.
Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor's.
Set in order your houses; keep slothfulness and uncleanness far from you.

verses.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

similars.text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor's.
For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
(For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)
Thou shalt not speak evil of thy neighbor, nor do him any harm.

And again, I command thee that thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife; nor seek thy neighbor's life.
Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Lord of Hosts.

Therefore if that man repenteth not, and remaineth and dieth an enemy to God, the demands of divine justice do awaken his immortal soul to a lively sense of his own guilt, which doth cause him to shrink from the presence of the Lord, and doth fill his breast with guilt, and pain, and anguish, which is like an unquenchable fire, whose flame ascendeth up forever and ever.

verses.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

similars.text: O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.
And inasmuch as they sought wisdom they might be instructed;
To another is given the word of knowledge, that all may be taught to be wise and to have knowledge.

When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.

For behold, my brethren, it is given unto you to judge, that ye may know good from evil; and the way to judge is as plain, that ye may know with a perfect knowledge, as the daylight is from the dark night.

For intelligence cleaveth unto intelligence; wisdom receiveth wisdom; truth embraceth truth; virtue loveth virtue; light cleaveth unto light; mercy hath compassion on mercy and claimeth her own; justice continueth its course and claimeth its own; judgment goeth before the face of him who sitteth upon the throne and governeth and executeth all things.
But to be learned is good if they hearken unto the counsels of God.
Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

Wherefore, O ye Gentiles, it is wisdom in God that these things should be shown unto you, that thereby ye may repent of your sins, and suffer not that these murderous combinations shall get above you, which are built up to get power and gain--and the work, yea, even the work of destruction come upon you, yea, even the sword of the justice of the Eternal God shall fall upon you, to your overthrow and destruction if ye shall suffer these things to be.

verses.text: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.

similars.text: Behold the Lord slayeth the wicked to bring forth his righteous purposes. It is better that one man should perish than that a nation should dwindle and perish in unbelief.
That no combination of wickedness shall have power to rise up and prevail over thy people upon whom thy name shall be put in this house;
But, behold, the judgments of God will overtake the wicked; and it is by the wicked that the wicked are punished; for it is the wicked that stir up the hearts of the children of men unto bloodshed.

And then shall it come to pass, that the spirits of the wicked, yea, who are evil--for behold, they have no part nor portion of the Spirit of the Lord; for behold, they chose evil works rather than good; therefore the spirit of the devil did enter into them, and take possession of their house--and these shall be cast out into outer darkness; there shall be weeping, and wailing, and gnashing of teeth, and this because of their own iniquity, being led captive by the will of the devil.
And he raiseth up a righteous nation, and destroyeth the nations of the wicked.
Who justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.

Condemning the righteous because of their righteousness; letting the guilty and the wicked go unpunished because of their money; and moreover to be held in office at the head of government, to rule and do according to their wills, that they might get gain and glory of the world, and, moreover, that they might the more easily commit adultery, and steal, and kill, and do according to their own wills--
Therefore ye shall ordain him unto this blessing, and he shall seek diligently to take away incumbrances that are upon the house named among you, that he may dwell therein. Even so. Amen.

Yea, and moreover I say unto you, that if this highly favored people of the Lord should fall into transgression, and become a wicked and an adulterous people, that the Lord will deliver them up, that thereby they become weak like unto their brethren; and he will no more preserve them by his matchless and marvelous power, as he has hitherto preserved our fathers.

verses.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.

similars.text: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.

O Lord, how long wilt thou suffer this people to bear this affliction, and the cries of their innocent ones to ascend up in thine ears, and their blood come up in testimony before thee, and not make a display of thy testimony in their behalf?
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
And upon them that hearken not to the voice of the Lord shall be fulfilled that which was written by the prophet Moses, that they should be cut off from among the people.
Yea, thou art merciful unto thy children when they cry unto thee, to be heard of thee and not of men, and thou wilt hear them.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Pray ye, therefore, that their ears may be opened unto your cries, that I may be merciful unto them, that these things may not come upon them.
And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.

And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

verses.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.

similars.text: Wherefore, the Lord commandeth you, when ye shall see these things come among you that ye shall awake to a sense of your awful situation, because of this secret combination which shall be among you; or wo be unto it, because of the blood of them who have been slain; for they cry from the dust for vengeance upon it, and also upon those who built it up.
Let thine anger be kindled against our enemies; and, in the fury of thine heart, with thy sword avenge us of our wrongs.

Therefore this is thy gift; apply unto it, and blessed art thou, for it shall deliver you out of the hands of your enemies, when, if it were not so, they would slay you and bring your soul to destruction.
And again, if your enemy shall smite you the second time, and you revile not against your enemy, and bear it patiently, your reward shall be an hundred-fold.

And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.
Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
Wherefore, a man being evil cannot do that which is good; neither will he give a good gift.
For Satan putteth it into their hearts to anger against you, and to the shedding of blood.
For behold, if a man being evil giveth a gift, he doeth it grudgingly; wherefore it is counted unto him the same as if he had retained the gift; wherefore he is counted evil before God.
Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift.

verses.text: It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

similars.text: And you shall be filled with joy and gladness; and know this, that in the day of judgment you shall be judges of that house, and condemn them;
Therefore remember, O man, for all thy doings thou shalt be brought into judgment.

And then cometh the judgment of the Holy One upon them; and then cometh the time that he that is filthy shall be filthy still; and he that is righteous shall be righteous still; he that is happy shall be happy still; and he that is unhappy shall be unhappy still.
And thus he has laid a cunning plan, thinking to destroy the work of God; but I will require this at their hands, and it shall turn to their shame and condemnation in the day of judgment.

And misery thou shalt receive if thou wilt slight these counsels, yea, even the destruction of thyself and property.

verses.text: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.

And when they shall say unto you: Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep and mutter--should not a people seek unto their God for the living to hear from the dead?

When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.
But he that remaineth steadfast and is not overcome, the same shall be saved.
For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

verses.text: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

similars.text: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.

Wo unto you poor men, whose hearts are not broken, whose spirits are not contrite, and whose bellies are not satisfied, and whose hands are not stayed from laying hold upon other men's goods, whose eyes are full of greediness, and who will not labor with your own hands!
It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

Wo unto you rich men, that will not give your substance to the poor, for your riches will canker your souls; and this shall be your lamentation in the day of visitation, and of judgment, and of indignation: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and my soul is not saved!
Wherefore, a commandment I give unto you, that you shall not purchase wine neither strong drink of your enemies;
And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.
Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor's.

Wherefore, do not spend money for that which is of no worth, nor your labor for that which cannot satisfy. Hearken diligently unto me, and remember the words which I have spoken; and come unto the Holy One of Israel, and feast upon that which perisheth not, neither can be corrupted, and let your soul delight in fatness.
Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;
So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.

verses.text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.

And the righteous shall be gathered on my right hand unto eternal life; and the wicked on my left hand will I be ashamed to own before the Father;

And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

But thus saith the Lord, even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.

verses.text: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.

similars.text: For she had supposed that we had perished in the wilderness; and she also had complained against my father, telling him that he was a visionary man; saying: Behold thou hast led us forth from the land of our inheritance, and my sons are no more, and we perish in the wilderness.

But they hardened their hearts and could not endure his presence; therefore, the Lord in his wrath, for his anger was kindled against them, swore that they should not enter into his rest while in the wilderness, which rest is the fulness of his glory.
Therefore, they tarried in the wilderness, or did not travel a direct course, and were afflicted with hunger and thirst, because of their transgressions.

Yea, except ye repent, your women shall have great cause to mourn in the day that they shall give suck; for ye shall attempt to flee and there shall be no place for refuge; yea, and wo unto them which are with child, for they shall be heavy and cannot flee; therefore, they shall be trodden down and shall be left to perish.
When thou tillest the ground it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength. A fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

And thou art like unto our father, led away by the foolish imaginations of his heart; yea, he hath led us out of the land of Jerusalem, and we have wandered in the wilderness for these many years; and our women have toiled, being big with child; and they have borne children in the wilderness and suffered all things, save it were death; and it would have been better that they had died before they came out of Jerusalem than to have suffered these afflictions.
Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days.
And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

verses.text: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.

similars.text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.
And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.
Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
And behold, if a man hide up a treasure in the earth, and the Lord shall say--Let it be accursed, because of the iniquity of him who hath hid it up--behold, it shall be accursed.
Seek not for riches but for wisdom, and behold, the mysteries of God shall be unfolded unto you, and then shall you be made rich. Behold, he that hath eternal life is rich.
Seek not for riches but for wisdom; and, behold, the mysteries of God shall be unfolded unto you, and then shall you be made rich. Behold, he that hath eternal life is rich.

verses.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

similars.text: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.
But learn that he who doeth the works of righteousness shall receive his reward, even peace in this world, and eternal life in the world to come.

And now, because ye are compelled to be humble blessed are ye; for a man sometimes, if he is compelled to be humble, seeketh repentance; and now surely, whosoever repenteth shall find mercy; and he that findeth mercy and endureth to the end the same shall be saved.
And whoso is found a faithful, a just, and a wise steward shall enter into the joy of his Lord, and shall inherit eternal life.
Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that cometh from God only?
But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:
But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

Therefore, if a man bringeth forth good works he hearkeneth unto the voice of the good shepherd, and he doth follow him; but whosoever bringeth forth evil works, the same becometh a child of the devil, for he hearkeneth unto his voice, and doth follow him.

verses.text: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

similars.text: And the mean man boweth not down, and the great man humbleth himself not, therefore, forgive him not.
And until this be accomplished, let not thy judgments fall upon that city.

And it came to pass that when he had fortified the city Gid, according to his desires, he caused that his prisoners should be taken to the city Bountiful; and he also guarded that city with an exceedingly strong force.
But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

And now, behold, this was wisdom in Moroni; for he had supposed that they would be frightened at the city Ammonihah; and as the city of Noah had hitherto been the weakest part of the land, therefore they would march thither to battle; and thus it was according to his desires.
Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:
And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

verses.text: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

similars.text: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:
And their tongues shall be stayed that they shall not utter against me; and their flesh shall fall from off their bones, and their eyes from their sockets;

A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.
But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.

And he said unto them: He that eateth this bread eateth of my body to his soul; and he that drinketh of this wine drinketh of my blood to his soul; and his soul shall never hunger nor thirst, but shall be filled.
He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
Cursed is he that putteth his trust in man, or maketh flesh his arm, or shall hearken unto the precepts of men, save their precepts shall be given by the power of the Holy Ghost.
Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

verses.text: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.

similars.text: He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.
For behold, and lo, vengeance cometh speedily upon the ungodly as the whirlwind; and who shall escape it?
For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?
And calamity shall cover the mocker, and the scorner shall be consumed; and they that have watched for iniquity shall be hewn down and cast into the fire.
Wherefore, all those who are proud, and that do wickedly, the day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, for they shall be as stubble.

And the world, because of their iniquity, shall judge him to be a thing of naught; wherefore they scourge him, and he suffereth it; and they smite him, and he suffereth it. Yea, they spit upon him, and he suffereth it, because of his loving kindness and his long-suffering towards the children of men.
Behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts shall lop the bough with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down; and the haughty shall be humbled.
Yea, verily, I say, hear the word of him whose anger is kindled against the wicked and rebellious;
Behold, the sword of vengeance hangeth over you; and the time soon cometh that he avengeth the blood of the saints upon you, for he will not suffer their cries any longer.

For he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil.

verses.text: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.

similars.text: He that is slothful shall not be counted worthy to stand, and he that learns not his duty and shows himself not approved shall not be counted worthy to stand. Even so. Amen.
And he shall snatch on the right hand and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand and they shall not be satisfied; they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm--
Let no one, therefore, set on my servant Joseph; for I will justify him; for he shall do the sacrifice which I require at his hands for his transgressions, saith the Lord your God.
For behold, it is not meet that I should command in all things; for he that is compelled in all things, the same is a slothful and not a wise servant; wherefore he receiveth no reward.
Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.
I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.

Perhaps thou shalt say: The man has brought upon himself his misery; therefore I will stay my hand, and will not give unto him of my food, nor impart unto him of my substance that he may not suffer, for his punishments are just--
Thou shalt not be idle; for he that is idle shall not eat the bread nor wear the garments of the laborer.
Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.
Now this people again refused to take their arms, and they suffered themselves to be slain according to the desires of their enemies.

verses.text: He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

similars.text: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
He suffered temptations but gave no heed unto them.
And it pleaseth God that he hath given all these things unto man; for unto this end were they made to be used, with judgment, not to excess, neither by extortion.
Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
And so it is on the other hand. If he hath repented of his sins, and desired righteousness until the end of his days, even so he shall be rewarded unto righteousness.

Wo unto you poor men, whose hearts are not broken, whose spirits are not contrite, and whose bellies are not satisfied, and whose hands are not stayed from laying hold upon other men's goods, whose eyes are full of greediness, and who will not labor with your own hands!

He doeth not anything save it be for the benefit of the world; for he loveth the world, even that he layeth down his own life that he may draw all men unto him. Wherefore, he commandeth none that they shall not partake of his salvation.

Now, I, the Lord, am not well pleased with the inhabitants of Zion, for there are idlers among them; and their children are also growing up in wickedness; they also seek not earnestly the riches of eternity, but their eyes are full of greediness.

He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard it. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

verses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?

similars.text: For behold, how much iniquity doth one wicked king cause to be committed, yea, and what great destruction!
Behold the Lord slayeth the wicked to bring forth his righteous purposes. It is better that one man should perish than that a nation should dwindle and perish in unbelief.
And notwithstanding he hath done all this, and greater also, there is no peace, saith the Lord, unto the wicked.
And now, how much more cursed is he that knoweth the will of God and doeth it not, than he that only believeth, or only hath cause to believe, and falleth into transgression?
But, behold, the judgments of God will overtake the wicked; and it is by the wicked that the wicked are punished; for it is the wicked that stir up the hearts of the children of men unto bloodshed.
And he raiseth up a righteous nation, and destroyeth the nations of the wicked.
And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:
Who justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!
Behold, I say unto you that ye would be more miserable to dwell with a holy and just God, under a consciousness of your filthiness before him, than ye would to dwell with the damned souls in hell.

And lo, he shall suffer temptations, and pain of body, hunger, thirst, and fatigue, even more than man can suffer, except it be unto death; for behold, blood cometh from every pore, so great shall be his anguish for the wickedness and the abominations of his people.

verses.text: A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.

similars.text: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:
And there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
Why seest thou this man, and hearest him revile against this people and against our law?
And thy people shall never be turned against thee by the testimony of traitors.
That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
Yea, verily, I say, hear the word of him whose anger is kindled against the wicked and rebellious;
And wo unto the deaf that will not hear; for they shall perish.
For he that raiseth up a king against me shall perish, for I, the Lord, the king of heaven, will be their king, and I will be a light unto them forever, that hear my words.

verses.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.

similars.text: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.
Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:
All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.
For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:
Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with me, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.
But unto the wicked he did not go, and among the ungodly and the unrepentant who had defiled themselves while in the flesh, his voice was not raised;
And the mean man boweth not down, and the great man humbleth himself not, therefore, forgive him not.
And for this cause I said that he is a wicked man, for he has sought to take away the things wherewith you have been entrusted; and he has also sought to destroy your gift.
Yea, and we also see the great wickedness one very wicked man can cause to take place among the children of men.

verses.text: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord.

similars.text: Let him that is ignorant learn wisdom by humbling himself and calling upon the Lord his God, that his eyes may be opened that he may see, and his ears opened that he may hear;

O how marvelous are the works of the Lord, and how long doth he suffer with his people; yea, and how blind and impenetrable are the understandings of the children of men; for they will not seek wisdom, neither do they desire that she should rule over them!
For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! When they are learned they think they are wise, and they hearken not unto the counsel of God, for they set it aside, supposing they know of themselves, wherefore, their wisdom is foolishness and it profiteth them not. And they shall perish.
Ye have not applied your hearts to understanding; therefore, ye have not been wise. Therefore, what teach ye this people?
Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:
For there is no respect of persons with God.
For, behold, you should not have feared man more than God. Although men set at naught the counsels of God, and despise his words--

Wherefore, brethren, seek not to counsel the Lord, but to take counsel from his hand. For behold, ye yourselves know that he counseleth in wisdom, and in justice, and in great mercy, over all his works.

verses.text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the Lord.

similars.text: I, the Lord, am willing, if any among you desire to ride upon horses, or upon mules, or in chariots, he shall receive this blessing, if he receive it from the hand of the Lord, with a thankful heart in all things.
And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that sat upon him was called Faithful and True, and in righteousness he doth judge and make war.
Yea, wo be unto the Gentiles except they repent; for it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Father, that I will cut off thy horses out of the midst of thee, and I will destroy thy chariots;
But verily, thus saith the Lord, let not your flight be in haste, but let all things be prepared before you; and he that goeth, let him not look back lest sudden destruction shall come upon him.
Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.

And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.
For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?
Now when Lamoni had heard this he caused that his servants should make ready his horses and his chariots.
And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.
And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.
